activities.loc: Br 10 - Law Enforcement Center - West Courtroom

result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Howard J Greene

records.addlTxt: Restitution hearing on January 9, 2023 at 02:30 pm.

1:57 PM Defendant Howard J Greene in court.  Attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon in court for Howard J Greene.  Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Sara Rogan. Atty Eric Gustafson on behalf of the insurance company. 
Defense makes statement as to what the insurance company is owed vs what they would agree to if there was not a contested hearing today.
Court holds colloquy with defendant about rejecting offer to agree to a certain amount instead of having the restitution hearing. 
Defendant gives statement. 

Parties go off the record for the defendant to speak to the attorney for the insurance attorney as well as his counsel. Back on the record at 2:21pm with same appearances as above. 
Defendant gives further statement as to why he is not agreeing to pay the $7000 or $12000.
State indicates they do not have a witness and the restitution information is 67 pages long. 
BTC: Matter set over.
Restitution hearing scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 02:30 pm.
Closed with the wrong code and corrected
Restitution hearing on October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

9:29 AM Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Howard J Greene in court, in custody.  Attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon in court for Howard J Greene. Parties are prepared to proceed with plea/sentencing today. 

State puts offer on the record. Defense confirms offer. 

Plea questionnaire filed. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant. 

Plea - 21CF1585 Cts 4, 5 & 6- GUILTY. 
21CF1549 Cts 2, 3 & 4- GUILTY.
22CF687 Cts 1, 2 & 3- GUILTY. 
Factual basis found in complaint. 
BTC: 21CF1585 Cts 4, 5 & 6 GUILTY with remaining being dismissed and read in.  21CF1549 Cts 2, 3 & 4 GUILTY with remaining being dismissed and read in. 22CF687 Cts 1, 2 & 3 GUILTY with remaining being dismissed and read in. 22CF715 & 21CF1340 will be dismissed and read in. 

State indicates there is a restitution request in 21CF13400 for $12,000 that will require a restitution hearing. 
Parties give arguments as to sentencing. .
Defendant gives statement. 

BTC: 
21CF1585- 
Cts 4 & 5- 3 years Wisconsin State Prison bifurcated 18 months initial confinement with 18 months extended supervision imposed and stayed on each count to run concurrent. 
3 years probation.

Conditions of probation:
120 days Racine County Jail STAYED
No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician, to be
monitored accordingly. 
Any assessments/counseling/treatment deemed appropriate by agent.
Obtain/maintain full-time employment and or schooling.
No contact with any known drug dealers or users. 
No establishment with primary sale of alc. 
Do not drive unless properly licensed. 
Firearm warning.
Voting warning.
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
Mandatory Court Costs+ DNA Surcharge

Defendant is not eligible for CIP
Defendant is eligible for SAP. 

Ct 7- 2 years Wisconsin State Prison bifurcated 1 year initial confinement with 1 year extended supervision imposed and stayed.
1 year probation. 

21CF1549-
Cts 1 & 2- 3 years Wisconsin State Prison bifurcated 18 months initial confinement with 18 months extended supervision imposed and stayed on each count to run concurrent but consecutive to 21CF1585. 
3 years probation.

Ct 4- 2 years Wisconsin State Prison bifurcated 1 year initial confinement with 1 year extended supervision imposed and stayed.
1 year probation. 

22CF687- 
3 years Wisconsin State Prison bifurcated 18 months initial confinement with 18 months extended supervision imposed and stayed on each count concurrent to each other but consecutive to 21CF1549. 
3 years probation.
Restitution hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:01 AM Prosecuting attorney Antoinette L. Rich in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Howard J Greene in court, in custody.  Attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon in court for Howard J Greene. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defense wishes to address bond.
State is okay to proceed.
Defense requests a signature bond. Defendant gives statement.
State objects with argument.
BC: Motion to modify bond denied. 

Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE
State's NOI to Introduce Certd Public Records

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

1:43 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Howard J Greene appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Sophia Dolan appeared by video for Howard J Greene. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Initial appearance on May 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.


Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
